detail.content: Post Production: Tisch School of the Arts at NYU                           Skip to content        Undergraduate Film & Television Admissions About the Program Course Offerings Summer Courses Showcase Internships Facilities Special Projects First Run & Festivals Calendar of Events News TSOA FTV Wiki Admin & Faculty Alumni Blog Facebook Twitter YouTube  home > Undergraduate Film & TV        Post Production                                          The Post Production Center (PPC) at NYU’s Kanbar  Institute of Film & Television provides all the state-of-the-art hardware,  software applications, and operational/technical support that are necessary to support  the editing needs of an artistic filmmaking community that produces almost 8000  student projects per year.                                         Approximately 150 workstations located on the 10 th   & 11 th floors of Tisch School of the Arts are loaded with Final  Cut Pro, Avid Media Composer, or Pro Tools (or combinations of all three  applications) and are available in various configurations: multi-station  computer labs; single station edit suites; ADR, Foley, Mix & Recording  studios; dubbing/duplication facilities; film & video screening rooms;  Sound FX stations, etc.). Staff  and student workers at the PPC Checkout Window on either floor are there to  give assistance and information based on the Film & Television curriculum.                                           Currently supported formats in the PPC include  HDCAM (NOT HDCAM SR), RED, DVCPRO HD, DVCAM, Panasonic  P2, Sony EX-1, and multiple file formats related to emerging technology such as  AVCHD based camcorders and Canon 7D/5D DSLRs . Students are encouraged to meet with full time PPC staff members  who are available to answer questions about these formats and workflows and to  assist students in finishing their projects. The PPC is open during the  semester seven (7) days per week, 12-14 hours per day. Students should be sure to read the PPC  signage on a weekly basis for updates on important dates such as closings,  weekly workshops, technical seminars, and other events that will add to the  creative experience here at TSOA. Facilities: Tisch School of the Arts at NYU                           Skip to content        Undergraduate Film & Television Admissions About the Program Course Offerings Summer Courses Showcase Internships Facilities Special Projects First Run & Festivals Calendar of Events News TSOA FTV Wiki Admin & Faculty Alumni Blog Facebook Twitter YouTube  home > Undergraduate Film & TV > Facilities          Digital Media Library The library staff provides students with access to audition/rehearsal rooms, screening rooms and an extensive collection of screenplays. More Production Center The largest production center on the Eastern Seabord serves the needs of all of our film and video students. More Post Production Film, video and sound editing, audio mixing, film-to-tape transfers and interformat duplication are provided in the Post Production Area. More Animation Area The Animation Area serves the needs of students for both animation and live-action projects. More Todman Center The Todman Center for Film and Television located at 35 West 4th Street More Teaching Soundstage The Teaching Soundstage serves as a location for both graduate and undergraduate classes. More 12th Floor TV Studios (TV12) Live television productions are an everyday occurrence in our Television Studios.
